top_visited_spots.description: A stunning white marble mausoleum built by Mughal emperor Shah Jahan in memory of his third wife Mumtaz Mahal. It's considered one of the Seven Wonders of the World.
A series of fortifications that were built over centuries to protect China from invaders. It's one of the most iconic landmarks in the world.
A vast temple complex and the largest religious monument in the world. It was built in the 12th century by the Khmer Empire.
An ancient Incan city located in the Andes Mountains. It's a UNESCO World Heritage Site and one of the most popular tourist destinations in South America.
An iconic wrought-iron lattice tower on the Champ de Mars in Paris. It's one of the most recognizable landmarks in the world.
